Imagine you're teaching a friend how to bake a cake for the first time. They might ask a lot of questions, some of them maybe even silly or repeated.

Being tolerant means you don't get annoyed or frustrated with their questions, even if they seem obvious to you. You understand they're learning and need your guidance.

Being composed means you stay calm and patient, even if they keep asking the same thing over and over. You don't snap or get flustered.

Maintaining a helpful attitude means you keep trying to explain things in different ways until they understand. You're genuinely interested in helping them learn.

So, even if someone is confused or keeps asking the same question, remember to be patient, understanding, and keep trying to help them in a friendly way!
